div.p: THE SOVNDING OF THE LAST TRUMPET OR Severall Viſions, declaring the univerſall overturning and rooting up of all Earthly Powers in ENGLAND. With many other things foretold, which ſhall come to paſſe in this Year, 1650.
Lately ſhewed unto GEORGE FOSTER, who was commanded to Print them.
Printed in the Yeare 1650.

div.head: The Epiſtle to the Reader.
div.p:
O Earth, earth, earth, hear the word of the Lord, and tremble thou earth, at the preſence of the mighty God of Iacob; for behold, he comes to take vengeance on his enemies, and they that have exerciſed oppreſsion ſhall be by the All of all, things confounded and brought to nothing, whether they be outward powers that have their fellow creatures in bondage to them, or the powers of fleſh, ruling and domineeering in them, Iſay both powers ſhall be brought to nothing, and ſhall not be able to ſtand any longer; for his excellent Majeſty appearing in brightneſſe, will be a terrour to all fleſh and all powers ſhall become as weak as water before him; and Lucifer that hath made the Nations to tremble, ſhall be brought to nothing, even all the power, ſtrength and glory of man ſhall be but as graſſe, and as the flower of the field that is ſoon cut down, and then comes to nothing, and is as if it were not; even ſo at the appearing of the Lord of hoſts, ſhall all powers of what ſort or under what notion ſ • ever be, in a very little while, as if they were not, and God alone, even the eternall God appeare to be King and Lord over all the Earth; at whoſe appearance all things beſides himſelfe ſhall be brought to nothing, even all POWERS ſhall become as nothing: and the mighty men, and great men, as Kings and Lords, for fear of the Lord of Hoſts, ſhall run into the holes of the rocks, and into the Dennes of the Earth to hide themſelves for fear of his Majeſty, for he doth now ariſe to ſhake terribly the earth, and all the earth
ſhall become dung before him; and all the powers of the earth ſha • l be as dung before his Inſtruments whom he hath made choice of, to do his great and terrible work: for he hath now a ſtrange work to do which will not be done by the powers of the earth; but the mighty Jehovah will do his ſtrange work by po • r, weak, and diſpiſed inſtruments, even by thoſe that are as nothing in themſelves, that the All of al things may appear to be their power and their ſtrength, and ſo through the ſtength of the mighty God, levell and lay mountaines and hils low, and make plaines n • d vallies equall with them: add ſo I will leave you to the enſuing Treatiſe, there to ſee what Gwd hath purpoſed to do: the which he hath been pleaſed to reveale to me by v • ſions, which power as I a • a creature ha • h ſo powerfully appeared in me, as I have not been able to reſiſt, but muſt ſend it forth th the publike view, as being one that that been made for a figne and wohder amongſt men, and ſo for my own puietneſſe ſake, and qeace of Spirit, I am made to put it to thy view, and ſo am contented to be a foole, and to undergo the hard and harſh cenſures of many, leaveing it to thy ſerious conſideration, or to thy malicious ſpirit, which may bite againſt it, and ſay I am deluded, and the Devil hath power over me: I'le leave it to you that ſee or heare of it; fo • time to make manifeſt what it is, and I'le wait upon the mighty God of Jacob, being confident he hath made out himſelfe unto me by Viſion and Revelation; and hath ſet me as a Wonder in the eyes of men: but wonder not as to mock and laugh at me leaſt your hearts be hardned, & ſo you be one of the veſſels whom the Lord will powre out the fiercenes of his wrath upon; for ſurely my God hath not ſet me as a ſign for nothing; if he hath, I am contented to be nothing, that he, the Lord of hoſts, may appear to be all: yea, I am confident the All of all things hath a very great work to do, & he hath made uſe of me, as of one that am a poor creature, purpoſely to ſ • t me a ſign, for
ſome to be forewarned that the Lord of hoſts is comming to deſtroy all things beſide himſelfe; that they may be willing when he appeareth to forſake all, and to count that which for the preſent is their God, as gold and ſilver, as nothing that they may cloath and feed the hungry, and ſo eſcape the day that ſhall burne as an Oven. But for others to be a ſtone of ſtumbling; a gin and ſnare at which they ſhall ſtumble and fall. And ſo Reader that thou maiest underſtand by reading of this treatiſe what God is now a doing: and how powerfull he is. For I have ſeen him to be very ſtrong, for theſe things following; I did much question whether they were not a deluſion of the Devill, by reaſon of the ſtrangeneſſe of them, & ſo did by queſtioning of them bring my ſelfe into a reſtleſſe condition: as ſeverall times to be tempted to make away my ſelfe. For theſe things ſaith the tempter, if thou publiſh them will make you a hiſſing and a laughing ſtock: and fleſh being willing to be at eaſe, I could have bin contented to have buried them in the bed of oblivion, & ſo thought to have hid them and not to have brought them forth, but the voice of the Lord came to me ſaying, that thou maieſt know that I the Lord of hoſts, I have made out unto the by viſion, & revealed things that ſhall ſurely come to paſſe, & that I have commanded thee to put them in print, & therefor • to go to London, thou ſhalt be dumb (and ſo I was for ni • houres) as a token to convince thee of thy unbeliefe.

And the next day, the voice of the Lord ſaid I ſhould be blind, as a token to convince me of my unbeliefe, which I was for eleven houres. And at the ſame time, the voice of the Lord ſaid: (for to haſten me away for to be a wonder in London) I ſhould be deprived of the uſe of my hand untill I did go up to ſpeak with Fairfax; and being thus taken ſpeechles and blind and my right hand cloſed up, that I could not open it; I'did come up to London, and being in London I did go to the Generals houſe for to ſpeak with him, but could not, then I
went againe, and could not; and the third time; but could not be admitted for to ſpeak with him: And all this while my hand was cloſed up ſo faſt that ſeverall that ſaw it did not conclude it was by a ſupernaturall power: and I did tell them that I had a meſſage to deliver to the Generall: but for the preſent I knew not what it was but I never did tell any that it could not be opened by force and ſtrength: but did tell them that I my ſelfe could not open it: but as ſoon as I did ſpeak with the Generall it ſhould open, which was now ſo cloſed for a ſigne to convince me of my unbeliefe, and alſo a ſtumbling-block for thoſe that did by violence open it; as a Prieſt for one, who was the chief cauſe of it, I being then in the Generalls houſe intending for to have ſpoken with him, as to deliver to him what God ſhould have made out to me. But I ſee it ſince to be the wiſdome of my God that I did not ſpeak with him, and likewiſe the wiſdome of God that my hand was opened by violence, that it may prove the fall of the enemies of Sion, and give them cauſe to mock and laugh at me; that ſo th • y may be for the ſlaughter when the Lord ariſeth to ſh • ke the earth terribly.

And this I writ • becauſe I would not have you wonder why I do not go to the Generall for to ſpeake with him, and ſo conclude that I am deluded, as they that open • d my hand did; for the wayes of God are paſt finding out, and my meſſage is done for the preſent in that I have endeavoured for to ſpeak with him, and I am as much ſatisfied with my condition as if I had ſpoke with him, for I ſee an over-ruling power and ſo am made for to wait upon that power that made all creatures (knowing that he will do his pleaſure) untill he doth in a more powe • full manner carry me forth in ſuch a way to act, which as I am a creature I am dead to, and when he appeares in power in his own time for to make uſe of me or a • any other of his creatures, they ſhall not be able to wi • hſtand him, as I f • r my own pa • t have not beene able to withſtand. So with this caution to you all, not to
mock at me leſt you mock not only me, but the All of all things, and ſo daſh your ſelves againſt that rock which will beat to pouder all other powers beſides himſelfe that he may be all and in all, I am willing to be ſilent, leaving my God to do with me, and all creatures, what he pleaſeth.

div.head: January 14 1650.
div.p: THe firſt day of the appearing of the eternall God in me, ſo as to make his excellent Majeſty moſt illuſtriouſly to ſhine in me as the moſt excellent and moſt glorious object, was by declaring himſelf to be my God, and that he was come to make himſelfe known unto me; who had a long time been in me buried under the clouds of proud fleſh, and I was ignorant of him, and though I was ignorant of him [of the eternall God dwelling in me] yet he did dwell in me, and was the life of me, which is a great myſtery, and vnknown to moſt creatures, though moſt profeſſe they know God, that God, even the eternall God dwels in them, by which they live and move and have their being.

But it hath pleaſed the infinite Iehovah [who is the fulneſſe of all, and fills the Creation with his grace] to appeare moſt gloriouſly in me, ſtripping and robbing me of all my former glory, that he alone may appear to be my all and in all, and ſo to declare and make himſelfe manifeſt to me, that he the eternall God doth dwell in me, and is the life of me, and that he will no longer be buried in me, but now will ariſe like a man of warre, tearing and deſtroying all proud fleſh which hath covered him, that he alone may appear to be my eternall King, and ſo to take me up into the full injoyment of himſelfe, by declaring in me, ſaying, I the Lord of hoſts am come, which voice was the moſt joyfulleſt voice that ever ſounded in mine eares, though it was a terrour to my fleſh, yet I may ſay with the Prophet, this is the day which the Lord hath made, come let us be glad and rejoyce in it. The Prophet was not ignorant that the Lord did make all the dayes, for he knew well enough the Lord did make all, but this day wherein he ſayes, he will rejoyce; was that day, even that day as the eternall God did appeare to be his God; and ſo apprehending him ſelfe by the manifeſtations of God to him, to be one with God, and no longer at a diſtance from God • , did cauſe him to rejoyce and be glad.

But who ſhall abide the day of his coming? or who ſhall be able to ſtand when he appeareth? Surely no fleſh ſhall be able to ſtand in that body when the mighty God of Jacob appeareth, neither ſhall any fleſh abide there, neither ſhall that creature in whom he is pleaſed to manifeſt himſelf, be able to oppoſe him, for the Lord will do all his pleaſure; He is like a refiners fire, and fullers ſop. The eternall God by his bright appearing in his ſons, he will purifie and refine them, by deſtroying that which hath troubled them, and hath kept them at a diſtance from him, and cauſe them to ſee evill no more, and to ſee former things to paſſe away, and all things become new: And thus it hath pleaſed my excellent Majeſtie who dwels in me, to make known himſelf unto me, that ſo J may ſee former things, or old things paſſe away, and all things become new: And as the eternal God caught Paul up into rhe third heaven, and he heard there words not fit to be uttered; becauſe if he ſhould have made them know, they could not underſtand them, by reaſon of the difference of diſpenſations wherein they lived, Paul being a father, & all they babes and children. So my excellent Majeſty the eternall God, having taken me up into himſelfe by his appearing in me in ſuch a high diſcovery of his love unto me, as to make me ſee himſelfe in me, and I to have no life but he to be my all; yea, my life, and that I can do nothing without him, who hath cauſed me to deliver my Kingdome, all my ſtrength [he being now the end of it] to my Father, that he may be all and in all: yea he hath [even my eternall God] ſo powerfully overcom me, that whether I was welling or no, deſtroyed my fleſh (for God is a conſuming fire) that he may take the kingdom to himſelfe, and ſo to be all, and in all in me: even thus it pleaſed my eternall God even in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye to ſtrike me dead, and likewiſe to raiſe me from the dead; and to cauſe me to heare the Angell ſound the laſt Trumpet, and ſo to take me up to meet the Lord in the aire, and ſo to be ever with the Lord, ſounding the tune of the ſeven Trumpets alwayes in mine ears, and cauſing me to hear the noiſe of the laſt trumpet, even the myſtery of God, ſaying, it is done, it is done, and time ſhall be no longer; making me to ſee ſeventy weeks, ſpoken of in Daniel, to be at one end, and ſo to ſee ſin and tranſegreſſion to be finiſhed, and to hear a voice within me, ſaying, everlaſting righteouſneſſe is brought in: This is that voice which hath already ſhoke the earth, but yet once more (ſaith my excellent Majeſty, who doth moſt gloriouſly ſhin in me) that he wil ſhake not only the earth again
but the heavens alſo: for it is not the worke of God onely to deſtroy the earthly powers and to bring them to nothing, though he will do it, but he will alſo deſtroy the heavenly powers, even that welfavoured harlot: even thoſe that thinke themſelves to be Iews and are not, as well Independency and Baptiſme way as he hath done Epiſcopacy and Presbyterie, and ſo to bring all fleſh in to confuſion, and to deſtroy the wiſdome of man that he alone may be exalted, and then wil the lord make a way in the wilderneſſe, and pathes in the deſarts. for to give water unto his people. And when the Lord hath done this great work, as he will do, to cauſe the poor creatures as think themſeves as lights and ſtars, and have taught otheres, to be nothing but in confuſion, then will they appear to be the wilderneſs and deſarts barren and empty; and that nothing will ſatisfie them but the powring of the ſpirit from on high, which is no other, but God appearing in them, and making himſelf known to them that he dwels in them, which dwelling in them will be as water of life unto them, and ſo will the Propheſies be fulfilled; I will do a new thing, which new thing willbe the depriving of the creature of all his ſelfe-righteouſneſſe or holineſte, and will make him to ſay, in the Lord have I righteouſneſſe, which righteouſneſſe will be God alone appearing to be the old way, and ſo will make them hear a voice behind them ſaying, this is the old way walke in it O the abundance of joy that is contained in theſe words: O it is the unſpeakable Ioy which the Apoſtle mentions, to hear God Preaching and ſpeaking to us, yea, in us: what a deale of labour will this ſave poor creatures, this will ſtay them from running to broken ciſterns that can hold no water, this will take them off from Idolizing Prieſts, when the voice of God ſpeaks in us behould, this is the myſterie that is to be made manifeſt to the ſons of Sion in theſe later dayes, Chriſt in them the hope of glory, that ſo in ſeeing God in them, and they to be in God, are the new jeruſalem that is com out of heauen, and ſo are the gueſts of that joyful wedding, hearing thoſe joyful w • rds, the mariage of the Lamb is ready, and ſo looſe themſelves to be married to the eternal God, and they to be the Lambs wife, and ſo by the power of the eternal God dwelling in them, they overcome and do inherit all things, by being brought into the injoyment of God, and ſo inherit all things in God; for God being theirs, all things are theirs, whether things preſent or things to come ſo that they ſhall now ſee weeping and ſorrow to be fled away, and ſo to go with everlaſting ſongs to Sion, in ſinging and dancing to
the houſe, of the Lord; Beloved this is that feaſt of fat things upon the mountaine, wine upon the leaves, even God the eternall King dwelling and manifeſtling himſelfe to you as he hath done to me, whereby I ſee by the excellent Majeſtie, the eternal God in me, that crooked wayes are now made ſtreight, and rough places made ſmooth; high places made low, and low places made high; fleſh brought to nothing, and God to be all and in all; all my life joy and ſtrength, and ſo no longer to labour and travell with child, but to bring forth, or declare that this eternall God is in me; and that he hath manifeſted himſelfe unro me, in a more extraordinary manner then ever before he did which extraordinary manner was as followeth.

As I lay awake in my bed between three and foure a clock in the morning Ian. 14. 1650. the Lord cauſed me to heare a pleaſant fit of muſick or melody, which muſick made me much admire, being ſo early in the morning, and one being with me I would faine have asked him if he heard or knew where it was; But as J was thinking to know where it was, I was taken in a ſtrange manner, with trembling, ſhaking; burning, and groaning, which made the party which lay with me much wonder and ſpeak to me, but J could not make him any anſwer. And after J had lain trembling and groaning [being full of paine within and without] for halfe an houre and upwards: J began to have abundance of inward joy and conſolation, even ſo full of joy was J that I was not able to containe my ſelfe, or expreſſe that comfort I had within me; but J did at length break forth in laughter, ſo heartily that I ſcarce ever laughed ſo heartily before, and did utter theſe words, the Lord of hoſts is come, and the moſt joyfull day that ever came is now, and no joy like unto this joy: and then afterwards was J taken with trembling and Groaned as I did before; and then afterwards I brake forth with laughing, and thus I did for foure times in the morning uſeing, the ſame expreſſions as J did at firſt: all this while beholding nothing with my outward eyes: for they were ſhut up that J could ſcarce open them, but beheld a glorious object within mee, which made me much rejoyce; and ſo I continued ſometimes rejoycing within my ſelfe, and ſometimes full of trouble, untill about twelve a clock at noon. And then was I taken in the ſame manner as before, and had three more fits; and in the laſt of the three, I being filled more with joy then in any of the reſt; J lifted up my hands and cryed out, the Lord of hoſts is come: And it is done, it is done, being ſo filled with joy as if it was the moſt joyfulls
newes which ever came to me; which ſince I have found it to be and that never no joy was like this joy to me, if I may ſpeake the truth and lie not. And afterwards I paſſed the day and night, ſometimes being full of joy, and ſomtimes full of ſorrow; and the next day being thurſday, J paſſed that with joy and went to bed, finding my ſelf prittie well ſatisfied (but not quite ſatisfied) and ſlept a while, but awaked about 2. a clock; and being awake I was much troubled in my ſelf and perplexed in my minde, but at length I heard a voice within me ſaying, heare my voice; and I cried out, who art thou that I ſhould heare? and I was anſwered with theſe words, I am the Lord of hoſts the holy one of Iſrael: and I was preſently, yea, of an inſtant taken with ſhaking and groaning; and being tormented in my minde; I then heard a voice ſaying to me, I am now come to torment thee, to conſume and burn thee up to nothing; and I did then apprehend a bundance of miſerie and ſorrow, crying out I was in hel: & preſently I was as ful of joy in apprehending a glorious God within me, which made me as much rejoyce & laugh within my ſelf, as if I had bin in no miſerie at all. yea, though I was in hel, & among all the Devils, I cryed out, ſorrow and ſighing ſhall flie away. Some 5, or 6. of theſe fits, in my miſerie, I cryed out I was in hel. In my joy I cryed out, the Lord of hoſts is come: and ſorrow and ſighing will now flie away; and that the Lord of hoſts will not ſhake the earth, but the heavens alſo. Theſe fits being over; there did appear to me four black horſes all in harneſſe, drawing and tugging as if they had bin in a cart that was ſet, and ſtrived harder then ordinary to get out: And I ſaid Lord, what is the meaning of this (ſighing and groaning untill I had an anſwer) and I was anſwered, that theſe do repreſent the powers of the world that do oppoſe God in his people, & all powers [that they are now ready to be drawn in pieces and theſe being vaniſhed: There appeared four horſes al' read, and I ſaid Lord what is the meaning of this, and the Lord ſaid, theſe do repreſent all powers to be in blood readie to be ſtrangled: and theſe being gone, there appeared 4. pale horſes like unto death (for J looked much upon them) for they looked very pale, yet not withſtanding they did brance up and down and kept a vaporing about. But preſently death ſeized upon them, and I beheld till I ſaw all powers throwne down, and covered in the earth that they ſhould riſe no more. And after theſe 4. pale horſes were covered under the earth, there appeared one white horſe without ſpot or ſtaine, and
one upon him all in glory, having a ſword in his hand, and he rid from Eaſt to Weſt & from North to South, and he ſaid, the kingdomes of this world are becom the kingdoms of the Lord, & he doth raign & Iſaid Lord, what doth this mean? and the Lord ſaid, That I the eternall God will appeare ſo glorious in my people to the burning up of fleſh and ſin, that they ſhall appear Conquerours and Kings; and I the Lord God am and will appear to be all and in all to my people. And as he prances from Eaſt to Weſt from North to South, without any let or hinderance: ſo ſhall my people live in the injoyment of me; and nothing ſhall make them afraid, and a little while after, I beheld an Angell coming from God and haveing in his hand abook, and it was open. And he came to me and bid me put forth my hand and take it, and eat it and I did put forth my hand and did take it, and (I ſaid) Lord what means this, and my God ſaid that this is a teſtimonie or a ſeal to you that I am come to you, and have put my law in your heart, and have writ it in your inward parts, and you ſhall ſin no more; and I was made to bow ſeven times to this Angell and my father ſaid, even ſo ſhall all fleſh bow to me in my people: and as the book was open in his hand, it ſhews that the myſterie which hath bin his is now to be made manifeſt and the everlaſting Goſpel to be preached.

And on the thurſeday morning between 5. and 6. a clok, I was taken with trembling and horror, and was ſtrook dead for a while ſo as I drew no breath at all, and at length I heard a great roaring of waters, which made a great noiſe, and when I came to my ſelfe, I groaned, and ſighed, and ſaid, Lord, what means this noiſe, and my excellent majeſtie which dwell in me, ſaid, that as you heare the roaring of waters and none is able to ſtill the noiſe? ſo ſhall my people, even my ſons come with ſinging and rejoycing to Sion and none ſhall make them weep any more: hearing of this, I was much taken with joy even overcome with joy, and continued full of joy I was taken as I was before, and my breath being gone from me again. I lay as dead for awhile; And did at length ſee a company of men and women ſtanding upon Sion, having harpes, and made muſick; and then came ſome others and they danced; and there was one more glorious then the reſt in the midſt of them. And I beheld till he that was in the midſt of them did go into them all and they became all as one.

And on Friday morning about five or ſix a clock, I was taken with horrour and feare, and was much perplexed (in my ſelfe) in mind and at length J heard a voice, ſaying, heare me, and obſerve what I ſay and write: That as I have tormented and plagued thee, ſo will I torment & plague all powers beſides my ſelfe: And J ſaid, Lord, wilt thou torment and deſtroy this Parliament? and the Lord ſaid J will deſtroy and conſume and bring to nothing the Parliament & all power that have exerciſed cruelty upon my people; & will give the glory, and honour and ſtrength of Kingdomes to my people, that there may be univerſall liberty and freedom, and will make the Wolfe and the Lamb lie down together, and be at peace one with another; and as you did ſee a white horſe, and one upon him all in glory the night before laſt night, with a ſword in his hand, riding from Eaſt to Weſt, and from North to South and none to oppoſe him and none to help him but that he did deſtroy all his enemies himſelfe: So I will (even by my own power and by my ſpirit) bring to nothing all the glory, honour, and power of all fleſhly powers that J alone may be and none beſides me, And J ſaid, Lord, how long will it be firſt? and the Lord ſaid, in a very little while, and J will overturne, overturne, overturne, and will appear in my Temple to the effecting of mine own work.

And on the 25. of January in the night, J was taken in the ſame manner as before, but only my fit of trouble was leſn'd and my fit of laughter more then any J had before: and after my mirth was over J was cauſed to lie ſtill. And J heard a voice of very great waters, which made me greeve within my ſelfe, untill I had an anſwer what they ſhould meane or what the noiſe ſhould ſignifie.

And at length my God within me told me, that the waters doth ſignifie the perſons of Sion ſinging and rejoycing in Sion; and as the noiſe of the waters was great, ſo ſhould the joy and gladneſſe of Sion be great, and as I heard a noiſe and did not know from whence it came; ſo ſhould their joy and gladneſſe come from God, within them and not from Creature objects. And I ſaid Lord they rejoyce and ſing allready; but my eternall God within me told me, that their joy now is mixt with ſorrow, and ſo is not perfect joy. But they ſhall ere long be brought into a full enjoyment of me, and then ſhall ceaſe from ſorrow.

And preſently after J beheld two Armies of men, one coming out of the North, and the other out of the South a little Weſtward. And the leader of them that came out of the South did ſeeme to be a very ſolentary man, and the other leader a fierce man, and J
beheld till they met one another, and had a ſharp bout of fighting one at the other. But at length the horſe belonging to thoſe that came out of the South (there being one very glorious amongſt them) broke in amongſt the foote and routed them and tooke their General, and ſo had the diſpoſing of the Field; and marched away preſently to London, and ſearched a great houſe; pulling thoſe that were in it out of it. And I ſaid Lord what meaneth this? and the Lord ſaid. That theſe be my inſtruments to deſtroy all powers, and to bring to nothing thoſe that are in power. And ſo to take the Kingdomes of this world, and to give them to the Saints. And moreover the Lord ſaid, that theſe his inſtruments by which he hath done this, he will ſo overpower that they ſhall not be like others, as to be a ſelf ſeeking people (no) but he will make them to be bright. That there may be no complainings in our ſtrees. And ſo reſtore the creation from the bondage it now groans under, into the Glorious liberty of the ſons of God. That there may be univerſal liberty and freedome; and moreover the Lord ſaid: that the faſhion of this world goeth out, or is now a deſtroying; and that the men of this world ſhall now uſe it as if they uſed it not; and that I will (ſaith the Lord) make thoſe that have riches diſpearſe them abroad. That that ſaying may come to paſſe, and that my inſtruments by which I will do theſe things, ſhall confeſs that it is not by power or ſtrength of men; but that it is God that is in them that doth theſe things. And ſo ſhall wholly deny themſelves from uſurping a power over others as to make Lawes for others to walke by. But as I have taken the power to my ſelf, ſo ſhall they leave me (ſaith my God) to do what I ſee good to all people; and my worke will be (ſaith God) to bring in univerſal libertie. And I ſaid how long Lord? And the Lord ſaid, within a moneth or a very little while, and it ſhall come to paſſe.

And in a little while after I ſaw a company of men and women ſinging and dancing, and they had every one of them a booke open in their right hand. And I ſaid, Lord what meaneth this? and my eternal God within me ſaid. That theſe repreſent my ſons and daughters that ſhall ſing and dance in Sion, and go up to the mountaine of the houſe of the Lord with everlaſting joy: and as they had every one of them a book open in their hands: it ſets forth that the myſterie which hath bin hid, is now by me (ſaith the Lord) made manifeſt, even Chriſt within them. And ſo ſhall be as my Thundering Angels crying out it is done, it is done, and time
ſhall be no more (ſaith my God) and ſo ſhall ſe tranſgreſſion finiſhed, & everlaſting righteouſneſs brought in. And all things with them to become new; former things be paſſed away. And ſo to be married to me the Lord: to be one with me. God living in them and they in God; and indeed are the new Jeruſalem that comes out of heaven, and the Tabernacle of God with men. Theſe fits being over, I was wrappped up in ſilence for a while: And the condition that I was in afterwards, was not a condition of horror, of trouble or feare, for about three nights before this, I heard a voice within me ſay, I am come, and will declare unto you, and I did waite for to have ſome thing from my God (by the working of my ſpirit within me) which having now, I was taken in a moſt pleaſant manner, & was forced to lie ſinging & whiſling; and then to riſe out of my bed between one and two a clock for to dance I and ſo continued ſinging & dancing neare upon two hours by the clock, ſinging in this manner as followeth, or the expreſſions which I uſed ſome of them I wil here relate, though I am not able to remember a quarter of them. The King, the everlaſting King, the King of glory comes; Halelujah, Halelujah, Halelujah, the Lord God omnipotent reignes: Sing, ſing, be glad O Sion! for behold thy King, the everlaſting King, the King of glory comes: ſhout, ſhout O Sion for behold thy King, the holy, one of Iſrael is in the midſt of thee; & thou ſhalt ſe ſorrow no more: now ore the kingdoms of this world becomthe kingdoms of the Lord, & of his Chriſt, & he ſhal reigne for ever. Sing, ſing, and rejoyce for behold thou ſhalt no longer have neede of the ſun of moon to give thee light, that is, outward ordinances, no but ſaith the Lord, I wil be thy light & glory. Sing & rejoyce, & go up with joy & rejoycing to the mountain of the houſe of the Lord; for now ſhal the light of the moon be as the light of the ſun. & the light of the ſun ſhal be ſeven fold more now then hath bin. Shout and be glad, for behold, I come; and he that is weake and feeble amongſt you ſhal be as David, & David ſhal be as the Angel of God, even as God: Sing & rejoyce, for behold you ſhal now ſay, this is the Lord our God we have waited for him, and he is now come; therefore let us be glad and rejoyce in his Salvation. Sing and rejoyce and be glad, for now the tabernacle of God is with men, and he will dwell with them: Shout, ſhout, crie aloude, ſpare not, lift up thy voice like a trumpet. And ſay unto Sion, thy King cometh: prepare, prepare, make ready, the marriage of the Lamb is now come. For behold, I come as a bride adorned for her husband. Sing and rejoyce for now Jeruſalem cometh out of heaven: and former things ſhall paſſe away, and now ſhall all things become new: Sing and make ready,
for the marriage of the Lamb is come: Shout and be glad for the water of life doth now appeare for to heale the Nations.

Crie. Crie, what ſhall I crie? Crie all fleſh is graſs, the graſs withers, the flower fades and comes to nothing, but • od abides for ever: Crie, Crie, the ſpirit of the Lord blowes upon fleſh, that ſo fleſh may come to nothing: I have a long time holden my peace and have bin ſtill, but now will I ariſe (ſaith the Lord) like a man of war and will teare and devoure in pieces and none ſhall deliver.

And now will I appeare to be (ſaith the Lord) the ſtone cut out of the mountaine: Crie, crie, what ſhall I crie? the Lord of Hoſts will overthrow the ſtrength of Kingdomes. And will appeare to be an Iron rod that ſhall breake in pieces all powers like a potters veſſel. And will make every one to throw their Idols of Gold and Silver away: money which men have made Idols of, ſhall now by the bright appearing of God, be counted nothing, but ſhal be thrown from one unto the other: And they that have abundance ſhall hide themſelves for feare of the Lord of Hoſts. Theſe and ſuch like expreſſions by way of ſinging I did utter: and why I count it ſinging, is becauſe I did (as being overpowered with joy) crie ha ha tall toll lall derah la loll la dero tall derall tall toll dero tall aroll atoll loll loll dero, in ſuch a way I did breake forth between every 4. lines I have writ or oftner.

And on the 29. day of the ſame month about 7. a clock in the night I ſaw in a viſion two armies of men one a coming againſt the other; the ſame Leaders that were in the viſion before, concerning the laſt two armies mentioned, & I beheld til they were drawn up in a body, ſeeing their drums beating and their collours flying; their muſquets charged, and the ſouldiers with lighted matches in their hands: and I beheld till J ſaw that theſe two armies did meet, and the muſqueteers fired and fell off, and J ſaw men ſometimes drap down: But at length J ſaw the Generals horſe (which came out of the South) break in amongſt their enemies and utterly routed them, and tooke the General and killed him, and ſo had the field to themſelves. And J ſaid Lord, what is the meaning of this? and my eternall God within me told me. That the General and his armie that came out of the South, are inſtruments which J have choſen to do my worke: and the other Generall and his Souldiers are for the Parliament: and J beheld til the General that overcame marched with all his armie to London, and entred the Citie, and went to the Parliament-houſe. But they were diſperſed,
and I ſaw the General and his Officers ſit as a Parliament in the roome of the other, and did promiſe that they would now reſtore freedome to the people: and I ſaw the General and his Officers go into the Halls where money was and threw it to the Souldiers, and the Souldiers had ſo much, that they gave it away to the poore; and I heard the poore ſay one unto the other, theſe are joyfull daies.

And I deſired the ſubſtance of it and it is this (as my Lord hath revealed it to me) That the General and the people with him are the inſtruments of God. And he hath choſen them for to beat in pieces all powers; and to threſh mountaines and hills to chaff • , that they may be no longer: and ſo to give the power to them that they may (or God in them) reſtore England from bondage: and by their giving of money away ſo freely, it ſhewes that the time is now come, that the Lord will redeeme the creation from bondage, and that I will (ſaith God) ſo breake that domineering ſelf that hath bin in man: That he ſhall now throw away his Idols of Gold and Silver: that there may be univerſal love and freedome, and warr ſhall ceaſe.

Well, afterwards I had much joy within my ſelf, ſo much that I am not able to expreſſe, and which cauſed me to breake forth in ſinging and dancing; and afterwards I was taken in a ſhaking fit, and after the fit was over, I was forced to give my money to them that were with me, and did give them all that I had.

So by the appearing of me (ſaith the eternall God) ſhall all mighty, great and rich men, throw and diſperſe their ſilver and gold to them that have need, that there may be no complaining in our ſtreetes.

And after this, I beheld a company of men and women with Crownes of gold upon their heads; and I asked my God, what meaneth theſe to have Crownes upon their heads? and my God ſaid, theſe Crownes betoken victory, for theſe are they that have overcome all things by my power, and have come out of great tribulation, and now have I wiped from their eyes, all ſorrow and weeping, and they ſhall reigne with me.

On the next morning about ſix a clock, as I was in my bed, I ſaw the ſame viſion as I did before, as ſoone as I ſaw the Army routed, and the General ſlaine, I cryed out, they are now cut downe; and ſo I did at the night before twice or thrice, I cryed they are cut downe, and did afterwards expreſſe a bundance of joy, both as it appeared by ſinging and lifting up of my hands; and in this fit, I
was commanded to declare it to the General, and was told me by a voice within me, that I ſhould have no reſt until I had declared it. And I asked who it was that commanded me to declare it? and the voice ſaid, I am that I am, the Lord of hoſſs, the King of Iſrael, and thou maiſt know I have made choice of thee to reveale theſe things, and that I have commanded thee to declare it to the General, and that my purpoſe is now to deſtroy all powers; yea, the Parliament, and that this viſion is from God: thou ſhalt be preſently taken in a ſhaking fit, and in a very little while I was taken ſo; and I deſired my brother that lay with me, to lie upon me, and ſo he did, to try whether I ſhould then ſhake, and I did tater him up and down and ſhake ſo much, that he could not make me lie: & about two a clock at noone, and on the morrow morning, I heard the ſame words as I did relate; that I have made choice of thee to reveale theſe things, & that thou maiſt know that I have commanded thee to declare theſe to the Generall, and that this viſion is from the Lord of hoſts, and that thou ſhalt have no reſt untill thou haſt done it; thou ſhalt be taken in ſuch a ſhaking fit, as thou ſhalt be ſhaken more then ever thou haſt been yet, and ſo I was of a ſudden: thus perceiving I ſhould be ſhaken, I laid me upon a bed, and called a man that was in the roome to lie upon me, and ſo he did lie upon me, and I ſhook him as if he had beene in a Cradle, and rocked by a man: And I deſired to know what I ſhould declare to the Generall, and my God told me, I ſhould declare that it was his determination to bring to nothing the Parliament, and ſo deſtroy all powers beſides himſelfe, that he may be all in all.

On the fourth day of the ſecond of February in the morning between five or ſix of the clock, at the appearing of my eternall God to me; and indeed I had great cauſe for to rejoyce: for my father within me, told me ſaying, I thy comforter, thy Redeemer & Saviour wil declare ſome things unto thee: & after my fleſh left trembling: I heard a voice ſaying, behold, behold, what doſt thou now ſee? and I beheld, and loe there appeared a company of men, and I told them and there were ſeven, that were very gallant, ſome of them had Sattin cloaths, and ſome of them were in cloaths that were laced with Gold and ſilver lace: and they had each of them two or three men a piece waiting on them, and they were merry: and I ſaid, Lord, what meaneth theſe? & the Lord anſwered me, &
told me; That theſe doth repreſent the Parliament; and as the were very merry amongſt themſelves, I beheld & there appears a hand upon the wall and writ theſe words, Mene, Mene, Tek: Peres: and I asked the meaning of this writing: and I was told that they were weighed in a ballande & were found too light: & their Kingdom ſhall be taken from them and given to others: & I beheld them that they were very ſad and hung down their heads at the appearing of this writing: and I heard a voice ſay, crie, crie, and I ſaid, what ſhall I crie? crie that the Lord of hoſt will bring down the Power, ſtrength and might of men, and will lay their honour ie the duſt: for my determination is to powere out upon them the fierceneſſe of my wrath and indignation, and all the earth ſhall be devoured with the fire of my jealouſie: for the day of the Lord is come that burneth as an oven and all they that do wickedly ſhal be as aſhes under the ſools of my feet; & I will take the Kingdome to my ſelfe and give it to my Saints: and after this was over: within a very little while my eternall God within me, uttered theſe words again: behold, behold, what doſt thou now ſee? & loe I beheld a company of men & women Singing and dancing together with Crowns of gold upon their heads: and I looked on them, and did ſee them put their hands in their pockets, and they pulled out their money and gave it to one another: & preſently after this I ſaw a company of men which were verry gallant (with their men waiting upon them) come to them and bowed to them: And I ſaid, Lord what are theſe that dance and ſing together? and the Lord ſaid, that theſe are my Sons and daughters, and three crownes betoken victory: that they have through the ſtrength of me overcome ſinne and fleſh, and now are come to Sion with everlaſting joy and rejoyceing, and ſorrow and ſighing is fled away; and theſe ſhall reigne with me. And whereas thou ſeeſt Lords & Knights & their men come with bags of Gold & ſilver, bowing & preſenting their money to them that were danceing: theſe ſhew the fullfilling of Scriptures: "that the ſons of them that afflicted thee ſhall come bending down to the ſoles of thy feet & ſhall call thee the bleſſed of the Lord, the Sion, the holy one of Iſrael, & that the Kings, and the fulnes of the Gentiles ſhall bring their glory and honour to it: and as thou ſeeſt my ſonnes receive their treaſure, and upon the reciving of it they became one, and their men put on their Hats, and were no longer SERVANTS but Fellowes with them: the time is now at hand that J will be ſuch a terror to all men that they ſhall throw away their idols of gold and ſilver
one to the other, for feare of the Lord, and for the glory of my Majeſtie, when I ariſe to ſhake terribly the earth: that they will no longer aſſume unto themſelves, ſuch a Preheminence as formerly they have done.

And after a little while I heard theſe words utter'd within me againe: behold, behold, what ſeeſt thou now? and lo I beheld an Angell with a ſickle in his hand come into a field of wheat; and I heard a voice ſay, thruſt in thy ſickle, for the harveſt is ripe: and I ſaid, Lord, who is this that hath a ſickle in his hand? and the Lord ſaid, this is my meſſenger that I have ſent; and the ſick'le in his hand is my power; by which he ſhall reap the harveſt withall, And lo I ſaw him thruſt in his ſickle, and cut downe all thoſe that were higher then the reſt, and ſo made all equall; and all the field became as one, in greatneſs none bigger then another. And I ſaid, Lord, what doth this field repreſent? and the Lord told me, That the field of wheat are men, and as you ſee the great eares cut from the little ones until they were all alike; ſo will I by my own power and by my bright appearing in my ſons and daughters; Cut down the loftineſs of men, and bring low their haughty lookes: and I like a mighty Leveller, will lay low-the mountains & hills, and make them as a plaine; and will make crooked pathes ſtraight, that I alone may be exalted: and ſo will take away that ſtumbling-block of private intreſt, that men ſhall no longer ſeeke for honour, as to warr one with another: but I will make them beat their ſwords and ſpeares into plowſhares preuning & hookes, that there may be univerſall peace and freedome, and all dwell in love together.

But in a little while after this, I heard the ſame words within me uttered. Behold, behold, what ſeeſt thou now? and lo I beheld a mighty Angel going from one end of heaven to the other, crying, Babylon the great is fallen, is fallen, and is thrown into the Sea, that it ſhall never riſe more. And my excellent Majeſtie within me (which is my eternal God) ſaid, by Babylon is meant all forms of governments and ways of worſhips which men have ſet up, and all Lawes which men have made to keep their fellow-creatures in bondage and ſlavery: but as thou ſeeſt this Angel throw a ſtone into the ſea and the ſtone never riſe more: ſo will I by mine own power take away the power of man for ever making any more Laws (to hang men) e • e long, and ſo will deſtroy the ſearletcollour'd whore, and will ſlit her noſe and burne her fleſh with fire;
for the heaven and the earth ſhall now flie away and there ſhall be no more place found for it.

And after this J heard the ſame words utter'd within me again. Behold, behold, what ſeeſt thou now? and lo I beheld a mighty Angel crying aloud, the Kingdomes of this world are now become the Kingdoms of God, and he ſhall reigne for ever and ever: and now the myſtery of God which hath bin hid ſhall be made manifeſt; and time ſhall be no longer; and now are former things paſſed away, and all things become new. And J ſaid, Lord, what is meant by this Angel? and the infinite God (by whom we live and move and have our being) ſaid that this Angel holds forth my ſervants crying againſt the powers of this world, and crying me up as the onely power that they will ſet up: and as he cried the myſterie of God is now finiſhed and time ſhall be no longer, it ſhewes that my ſons and daughters ſhall ſee & know the myſterie of God; which myſterie is, God in them: and that they ſhall now ſay, time ſhall be no longer: by Gods working ſo powerfully in them burning up ſin and fl • ſh, that ſo ſin and fleſh or Satan, ſhall no longer have any power over them; but God will be their all and in all, & they ſhal now ſe it and know it too; which will occaſion them to crie time ſhall be no longer. And thus by the ſtrength of me (who am the Alpha and omega) they overcome all things, & ſo all things are become new: & ſo my ſons & daughters ſhall inherit all things: for the Angel after he had cried all things are become new: ſo he cried, they ſhall inherit all things: for my ſons and daughters (ſaith my God) ſhall now ſee me to be all and in all, and ſo ſhall ſee and inherit all things by the injoyment of me: for the myſterie being finiſhed in you, and all things become new: it is ſuch a change in you, that thoſe things that you thought were unlawfull before, will now appear to be lawfull: for this is the new thing, you will now ſee and know that all things are Gods, and ſo will ſee and know that as God is yours, ſo all riches, as houſes or Lands, are as much yours as any mans; for ſaith God; time ſhall be no longer. You ſhall know this (ſaith God) that ſinne and tranſgreſſion being finiſhed with you, and everlaſting righteouſneſſe brought into you, and ſo ſwallowed up with righteouſneſſe, living in God, and God in you, you ſhall know that my worke, my ſtrange work which I wil do, is now to break in pieces al things, and to make all things become new: which change is to reſtore the whole creation from bondage and ſlaverie, into the glorious libertie of the ſons of G • d; and ſo to take off the curſe that is upon all
crearures, and to reſtore the creation to the firſt eſtate, as Adam was ſet in; that as I made Adam Lord over all creatures, and all creatures were for the uſe of Adam (ſaith the Lord) ſo now ſhall all the creatures men and women, have that priviledge (which by reaſon of the curſe) have a l • ng time bin deprived of as to have the injoyment of the outward creatures, which now they ſhall have: for as the appearing of me in one ſingle perſon Jeſus Chriſt my anoyted Son, did cauſe a communion to be among my Saints in thoſe dayes; ſo at the appearing of me in my ſons and daughters now, I will cauſe union and fellowſhip to increaſe, firſt amongſt my ſons and daughters, and then will burne up ſome by my ſpirit in them, and will confound others by might and power; and will make ſuch a ſtrange worke, that I will make all ſorts and degrees (ſome for feare of me, and ſome from the injoyment of me) give up give up, and relieve one another; that there may be univerſal love, peace and freedome; all enjoying the worke of my hands without let or hindrance,

And being carried above my ſelf (or taken out of my ſelf) with joy, I burſt forth crying Halelujah, Halelujah, the Lord omnipotent reignes: but could not reſt my ſelf contented until I did burſt forth with ſinging, becauſe of the abundance of joy I was in.

And on the 5. day of the ſecond moneth in the morning, came the word of the Lord unto me and ſaid,, I come: which made my fleſh to tremble: and at length I heard theſe words within me, behold I come to reveale unto thee things that muſt ſhortly come to paſſe: therefore behold what thou now ſeeſt. And lo, I beheld a great water, for the bigneſſe of it I could ſee no earth or ground; and in the midſt of it a woman gloriouſly araied, ſitting on a throne with a Crowne upon her head, and preſently there came one with a ſword in his hand, and cut off her head, and ſhe and her head tumbled into the ſea: and I ſaid (Lord) what meaneth theſe waters and this woman that ſitteth thereon? And the man that came with a ſword in his hand and cut off her head; and my eternall God (within me) ſaid: that the waters and multitudes of people: and the woman, is the Queen or the whore of Babylon, mentioned in the Revelations, that hath made all nations drunk with her fornication; and this Queen, or lady, that ſaith ſhe ſhould ſee no ſorrow: is Governments, and worſhips, and lawes which men have made and ſet up; and the man that came with a ſword in his hand and cut off her head; is my meſſenger which J have ſent, or my ſelf
appearing in my ſons and daughtera, which will cut off all power, as Kingly and Parliament powers, and ſo will deſtroy all Governments and forms of worſhips. And when her head was cut off: I heard a lamentation, men and women weeping and grieving, and ſome I ſaw were laughing and ſinging, crying Halelujab, Halelujah; for thou art worthie to receive Glory, and Honour, and praiſe; for thou haſt Judged the great whore, and taken vengeance on her for ſhedding the blood of the Saintt. And I ſaid (Lord) who are theſe that weep? And who are theſe that rejoyce? and the Lord ſaid that theſe are the Prieſts and thoſe that have bin made rich by her fornications that weep and howle: as the Prieſts that have made merchandiſe of ſouls of men: but now their trade is deſtroyed, and they ſhall no longer preach as to receive money for it; therefore they weep: but theſe are my ſons that ſing and rejoyce; and indeed they have now great cauſe for to ſing and rejoyce, becauſe that which hath troubled them (as formes and worſhips) are now deſtroyed: and I ſaid Lord, wilt thou deſtroy the Parliament? and the Lord ſaid, I will begin firſt in this nation, and will by my bright appearing burn up ſome, and deſtroy others: that there ſhall (to mens apprehenſion) be nothing but confuſion; for I will make great and mighty men run into the holes of the rocks, and throw away their Idols of gold and ſilver for fear of me, that there may be univerſal love and freedome. And I will be ſuch a terror to the great men, they ſhall hide themſelves for fear of me. And I ſaid (Lord) wilt thou do this by thy own power without making uſe of any Inſtruments? and the Lord ſaid no: but I will harden the hearts of the Parliament, and they ſhall raiſe an armie for to fight with the Generall, whom I will ſtir up to oppoſe their crueltie, and their actions, and ſo will deſtroy their power by my Inſtruments: and I ſaid Lord, ſhall I go and declare this to the Generall as yet or no? and the Lord ſaid wait upon me as yet and thou ſhalt know more, for I have ſomethings elſe to reveal unto thee.

And at night about eight of the clock on the ſame day, being in my chamber, the word of the Lord came unto me ſaying, behold, behold, what doſt thou now ſee? And I looked and loe a white horſe and one upon him with a ſword in his hand ready drawn: and he rid from Eaſt to Weſt, and from North to South, cutting down all men and women, that he met with, that were higher then the middle ſort, and raiſed up thoſe that were lower then the middle ſort, and made them all Equall, and cryed out epqualitie,
equalitie, in that I have now made all men alike: and he lifted up his hands to heaven, and did ſweare by him that liveth for evermore, time ſhould be no longer; and ſo did thruſt his ſword into his ſcabberd again. And I ſaid, Lord, who is this that makes all alike? and my glorious God within me ſaid: that I the Lord of hoſts have done this: and I ſaid, without any inſtruments Lord? and the Lord ſaid, no: but by inſtruments which I have choſen to do this ſtrange work: which ſhall cut down all powers, even the Parliament, and I ſaid Lord, ſhall the Parliament raiſe forces againſt thy inſtruments to fight with them? and the Lord ſaid they ſhall, but they ſhall be deſtroyed by Fair. (whom I have made choice of, and his Army: and whereas he cryed, time ſhall be no longer, and ſo put up his ſword into his ſheath againe: the meaning is: that when the time appointed is come, all viſible powers ſhall ceaſe: and I alone will be all and in all, both King and Parliament, and Governor; and then wars ſhall ceaſe. And as you ſee him make all alike; ſo will I deſtroy ſome, and burne and conſume others, and be as a terror to the reſt; that there ſhall be none greater or richer then others. And I ſaid, how long will it be firſt? and the Lord ſaid, in a very little while it ſhall come to paſſe, but wait thou upon me and thou ſhalt know; upon this I deſired of my God, that if he had judged me worthy to reveale this viſion to me, and that it ſhall come to paſſe, and that it was from the Lord of hoſts: I might have ſome token that I may know it to be from God: and my God ſaid within me. That I ſhould be preſently ſhooke as if I ſhould be ſhoock to pieces, as a token that he had made choice of me to reveale this viſion and the reſt to, and that it ſhould ſurely come to paſſe: which token proved true, for I was preſently ſhoaken, even ſo much that two men (which were in the roome with me, that I deſired to lie upon me or hold me from ſhaking, which they did) could not keep me from ſhaking.

But before this fit came on me one houre and halfe or ſuch a matter, I ſaw a company of men and women, ſinging and dancing, giving away their money one unto the other: and my God within me, told me, that theſe were my ſons and daughters that were come to Sion; and that he had now wiped all teares from their eyes: and that ſelf-ſeeking is now ended with them: and inſtead of it there ſhall be univerſal lvoe, or a communitie, like unto the communitie of his Saints mentioned in the Acts: whereupon I was forced for my owne reſt, to give away that little money I had,
about me: which thing others ſhall be made to do hereafter.

Againe the word of the Lord came unto me ſaying (about one a clock on the 6. day of February) Behold, behold, what doſt thou now ſee: and lo! I beheld an Army of men with their drums beating, and their colours flying, and they were upon their march: And I beheld till there came one to their General, being all glorious: and gave the General a ſword, and ſaid take this ſword, for with it ſhalt thou beat down all thine enemies: and I ſaid Lord, what is this Generals name? and the Lord ſaid his name is Fairfax; the Army that are with him are my inſtruments whom I have ſtirred up to hate the oppreſſion, covetouſneſſe and crueltie, of the Parliament. And whereas thou ſeeſt one give him aſword. It is I the Lord of hoſts, that have given him power to beat down all thoſe that are coming to fight wi • h him: and preſently I beheld another Army of men coming to fight with them: and I ſaid, Lord, who doth this Army fight for? and the Lord of hoſts ſaid, they fight for the Parliament: and the Lord ſaid, I ſti • red him up to oppoſe the Parliament, b • cauſe they have exerciſed crueltie upon my people: and I beheld ſo long, that at length I did ſee both theſe meet together and did fight; and I beheld ſome now and then dropped down of Fair. his men; but they fell apace on the other ſide: but at length Fair. horſe routed the o • her horſe, and followed ſome of them in purſuit; and ſome of them came and fell upon the foot, and at length broke in amongſt them and routed them, and tooke the General and killed him, and ſo had the field.

And I ſaid Lord, wilt thou alſo deſtroy the Parliament? and the Lord ſaid he would do it. for ſaith the Lord, I will now • urne Leveller, and will level mountaines and hills, and will make them equall with low places and vallies; that there may be univerſality. And I ſaid, how long will it be firſt? and the Lord ſaid in a very little while and it ſhall come to paſſe, and I ſaid, Lord, ſhall I go to the Generall and tell him of it? and the Lord ſaid I ſhould go: but ſhould ſtay a little longer firſt. And ſaith the Lord, whereas I ſaid (when I ſhewed thee this viſion at the firſt) that thou ſhouldeſt have no reſt untill thou hadſt done it: ſo I have troubled thee ever ſince day by day, and will till thou haſt done it: but thou ſhalt ſtay a little longer and wait upon me; and that thou maiſt know, I the Lord of Hoſts the mighty God of Jacob, by whom thou liveſt, • oveſt, & haſt thy
being hath done this, Thou ſhalt be preſently taken in a ſhaking fit: that thou maiſt know I have made choice of thee: which fit of ſhaking came on me as ſoone as the words were ended: which terrified my fleſh, but my Spirit rejoyced within me for joy.

And in a little while after: the Lord within me ſaid; behold, behold, what ſeeſt thou now? and lo, I ſaw the heavens roleld up together as a Scroul: and figges fall off the figg-tree before they were ripe: and I ſaid Lord, what is meant by the heavens rolling thus together as a ſcroule? and the Lord ſaid, by the heavens, is meant, all outward adminiſtrations or forms of worſhip; preaching and baptizing: and I ſaw one throw the ſrcoule into the fire, and it was conſumed; ſo ſaith the Lord, ſhall all outward heavens be burned up; and the figg tree is the Parliament in this nation, and it repreſents all powers which are a bringing forth ſome young figgs, which are ſome new formes or wayes of worſhip, or a doing ſome new thing, but before they can bring them to perfection, the day of the Lord overtakes them, and ſhakes them, and cauſes the figgs to fall off before they be ripe: and ſo I the Lord deſtroy the things that men would do.

And the Lord again ſaid: behold, what ſeeſt thou now? and lo, I beheld foure men ſtand upon the foure corners of the earth; which is Eaſt, Weſt, North and South, and they held the winde in their hands that it could no longer blow upon the earth or Sea: and I ſaid Lord, what meaneth theſe foure men to do thus as they do? and my excellent Majeſtie the Lord of hoſts ſaid, theſe foure men are my ſons and daughters in whom I have ſpread my ſelfe through out the world. And by the wind which they hold in their hands, that it ſhould blow no more upon the earth or Sea: is meant all outward formes or wayes of worſhip, which of one kind or other have bin in all places, ſet up by men: but now I have taken their power from them, and have given it to the Saints; and by my bright appearing in them, they ſhall not ſuffer any formes or wayes of worſhip to be ſet up.

And again the Lord ſaid: behold, behold, what ſeeſt thou now? and I beheld a Throne and one that ſet thereon; before whoſe face heaven and earth fled away, and there was no place for them: and I ſaid what is meant by this Throne? and the Lord ſaid, by this Throne is meant my ſons and daughters: and as you ſaw one that ſat thereon: tis I the Lord of hoſts who •… rule and reigne in my ſons and daughters; and they are my temple and houſe wherein I dwell: and by
the heaven and earth that fled away is meant: all earthly powers, Governments and formes and wayes of worſhip, all outward adminiſtrations, which by the appearing of me the God of Gods, ſhall be conſumed and burned up; that they may never be more: but that I the God of Gods, may appear to be their teacher and ordinances, and ſo all and in all: and ſo my Covenant of grace ſpoken off by Jeremiah my ſon, be fulfilled: you ſhall not need to ſay, know the Lord: ſo they ſhall know me from the leaſt to the greateſt: and that other Propheſie, ye ſhall be taught of God.

And on the ſeventh day of February, The word of the Lord came unto me, and ſaid behold, behold, what ſeeſt thou? and loe, I beheld, and there appeared a table and a cloth laid upon it, and trenchers and napkins upon it, and ſtooles pulled out for men to fit upon them: and one cried with a loud voyce, come all ye fowls of the heavens to the ſupper of the great God: and preſently there were diſhes of all ſorts of meat ſet upon the table: and after this I ſaw three froggs creeping up and down, and at length they entred into Kings and Lords, and great men; and preſently they gathered themſelves together and their armies; and I ſaid Lord, what is the meaning of this Table; and of the things that are there on? and my God ſaid, the table is the earth: and the things thereon being of all ſorts, repreſent, all things in the earth: and I ſaid, what is he that makes the ſupper? and calls all the foules of the heaven to come to it? and my eternall God within me ſaid: it is I the Lord of hoſts that make this ſupper, and invite the foules to it: and I ſaid, what foules? and the Lord ſaid: by foules you muſt underſtand; my ſons and daughters who live in the heavenly injoyment of me: and they have all ſorts of things here to ſupper: I, even the fleſh of Kings, and Lords, and mighty men, and captaines, and of all both ſmall and great, bond and free: it ſhewes that the day is now a coming that they ſhall have the full injoyment of all creatures, and ſo ſhall inherit all things: the fleſh of Kings and great men which they eat, is the wayes of worſhips and formes of governments which they have ſet up: their eating of them, ſhewes a final conſumation of them, as that they ſhall be conſumed and never be more: the three froggs that went into the King and great men of the earth; are the ſpirits of devills, which is the proud fleſh domineering over the ſpirit of God, & ſo ruling in their hearts, maks them raiſe armies of men, & gather their forces together to reſiſt the appearing or coming of
me ſaith the Lord of hoſts: And thus through the pride of their hearts and loftineſſe of their ſpirits, they gather Gog and Magog together, to compaſſe the Saints round: But I ſaid, what is meant by Gog and Magog? and the Lord ſaid, by Gog and Magog, is meant, all the wiſdome, power, and ſtrength of proud fleſh, which the great and wiſe men of the earth have invented, as their power on one ſide, and their falſe wayes of worſhips, and formes of governments on the other ſide, and Lawes which they have made, to make the Saints and people ſubmit unto, are the great armies that compaſſe the Saints round, or make war with me, ſaith God: But you ſee fire come out of heaven and burne them up; ſo by the bright appearing of me, ſaith the Lord of hoſts, ſhall all the enemies of my Saints (which have deceived them) be conſumed and burn • d up; as formes, and governments, and wayes of worſhips, that they may be no longer deceived by them: and I beheld the Devil that had deceived them; and I did at length ſee him thrown into the lake of fire that burneth with brimſtone, there to be tormented with the falſe Prophet day and night: and I ſaid, what is meant by the Devil thrown into the fire? and my God ſaid, by the Devil is meant all the wiſdome, cunningneſſe and craftineſſe of proud fleſh, which hath invented formes, and wayes of worſhips to deceive the people: they are all now burnt up and conſumed by the fire of my jealouſie, ſaith the Lord of hoſts, and are to be day and night tormented by me: That is, all proud fleſh and falſe Prophets (which is the wiſdome of the fleſh) ſhall from day to day, and from night to night, be under my wrath, and afraid to looke me in the face: and ſo by my appearing (ſaith the Lord of hoſts, who am a conſuming fire) ſhall they be tormented: who? all fleſh and filthineſſe, the power and wiſdome of men Gog and Magog: that I (the Lord of hoſts) may be all in all: For this lake of fire, is my w • ath (ſaith God) into which I have judged and ſentenced proud fleſh (that oppoſes me and throwne it; that ſo I may conſume proud fleſh, and bring it to nothing.

And againe the Word of the Lord came unto me, ſaying, what ſeeſt thou now? and I looked, and preſently I ſaw a great City, which to me did appear to be very gallant, as if there were none like it: and I ſaid, Lord, what meaneth this City, or what City is this? and my Eternall God within me ſaid, this great City is ſpirituall Sodom and Egypt, where the Son of God was crucified: and I ſaid, Chriſt was crucified at Jeruſalem: though he was (ſaith
the Lord of hoſts) put to death by the Jewes, yet he was alſo crucified in Sodome and Egypt; that is, the Lawes, and formes, and cuſtomes of the Jewes, is Sodome and Egypt; becauſe their Lawes and formes did ſlay my Son; and though he was put to death literally a •
Jeruſalem, yet he was perpetually ſlaine by the filthy abominations of Sodome and Egypt, as Rebellion and diſobedience againſt me the Lord of hoſts: and ſo (ſaith the Lord of hoſts) all formes, Lawes, governments, and wayes of worſhip oppoſing me, is ſpiritual Sodom: and Egypt, that put to death my Son Chriſt, and hath from time to time, been the great whore that hath ſhed the blood of my Saints. But as thou ſaweſt one ſet it one fire, and the people which thou ſaweſt running to quench it, as Kings, and Lords, and great men, and of all ſorts of men, with buckets of water, and hookes, to pull down ſome of it, that was on fire, but they could not quench it, as thou didſt ſee untill the tenth part of it was conſumed: I the Lord of hoſts (by my appearing in my ſons and daughters) have ſet this City on fire, and it hath been burned a long time; by my manifeſting my ſelf to them to be their all in all: and now the day of my judgement is at hand; I have ſentenced this City to be burnt, for I the Lord of hoſts, doe burne up and conſume all formes and governments of men by my ſelf, I being a conſuming fire: and I ſaid, Lord, what meaneth that, that the tenth part of it and not all, is conſumed? and the Lord ſaid, by the tenth part is meant all: for ten is a perfect number; as ten hornes mentioned, that ſets forth a perfect ſtrength, or all their ſtrength, or all their power: and I ſaid, Lord, it hath been generally underſtood, to be Nations, as our Nation for one, that ſhall fall off from Rome firſt, to be the City: but I the Lord of hoſts ſay, this City is formes and Lawes, Governments, and wayes of worſhip, which is in all Nations, and ſo is the ſpirituall Sodome and Egypt that crucified my Son; and hath from time to time, murdered my Saints: But the time of her power is almoſt at an end, and ſhe muſt be deſtroyed.

And whereas you ſee all ſorts of people run to quench the fire that it did not burne: It ſhewes the unwillingneſſe of all ſorts of men and women to have that which hath moſt deceived them, to be burned up; becauſe ſome, yea moſt, have made the obſervations or traditions of men, to be their rule to walke by: and ſo have walked more by forme and cuſtorne then by any thing elſe: But now I come, I come, ſaith the Lord of hoſts; and I will take from men, & from the powers of the world, thoſe things which they have gone
a whoring after: and they with all their might ſhall not hinder me from doing my worke.

And the word of the Lord came againe unto me, ſaying, Behold, behold, what doſt thou now ſee? and lo, I beheld a Temple, and it was full of ſmoke; and there appeared one in this temple with a crown of gold upon his head; and his rayment was of all colours, like unto a rainbow: and I beheld that he ſtretched forth his hands; and as he ſtretched them forth, the ſmoke vaniſhed away: and I beheld that after the ſmoke was gon: there went out of his mouth flames of fire, and burned up the pictures that were in the Temple: and after they were conſumed he cryed with a loud voice that the fourtie and two moneths and the time, times and halfe times, is now come to an end and then the temple and holy city which for 42 moneths was given to the Gentils to be troden under foot; ſhall now no longer be troden under foot: But I will redeem it and deliver it from the bondage and ſlavery that it hath bin ſubject unto: and after this I beheld ſeven lighted torches brought into the temple. And ſaid, I Lord whoſe temple is this? and the Lord ſaid, it is mine: and I ſaid, what doth this temple ſet forth? and the Lord ſaid; this temple are my ſons and daughters: and he whom you ſee in it, is I the Lord of hoſts who am come to take poſſeſſion and to make them my dwelling-place: But as you ſee it was full of ſmoke: this ſmoke is darkneſſe, and gloomineſſe, and cloudineſſe, and ſuch a miſt, that untill it be conſumed, my people are not able to know me: but I ſaid, Lord it is ſaid, that no man was able to enter into the temple for the ſmoke: which ſeemes to hold forth the temple to be ſomewhat elſe then thy Saints: and the Lord ſaid; that is a metaphor which ſeems to hold forth ſome thing elſe, that is, my ſona and daughters are not able to come to the true knowledge of me, as to ſee and know that I live in them, without a more fuller diſcoverie of my ſelf to them, ſaith the Lord of hoſts: but as you ſee me ſpread forth my hands; and the ſmoke vaniſhed away, that they come to have ſome knowledge of me: but as you ſee flames of fire iſſued forth from me that burned up the pictures: theſe flames are a full manifeſting of my ſelf to my ſons and daughters: and the pictures, are all the wayes of worſhip, formes and governments which by the wit of man are ſet up: and as pictures reſemble ſomething elſe beſides what they are; ſo theſe formes, and wayes of worſhips, and governments, and all outward adminiſtrations, have ſeemingly appeared to be the way which I would have them obſerve:
Though indeed it hath been but a picture of me. Or my way: and not my right way, or mine own way, but a way of confuſion So that when I ſhall fully manifeſt my ſelf to my ſonnes and daughters: my ſpirit ſhall burn up all their pictures; that is, all their wayes of worſhip and formes of what ſort ſoever, and conſume them to nothing: for I the Lord of hoſts am a conſuming fire; and will ere long appear to be ſo: that they may ſee me to be forms and wayes of worſhips, and ſee me all and in all: and ſo to ſee that they ſhall have no need any longer of outward adminiſtrations: But to ſee me to be their teacher: & I ſaid, Lord what is meant by the temple or holy City that hath been troden under foot 42. months? by this temple or holy City; is meant, my ſons and daughters which for the time of Antichriſts reign hath bin kept in darkneſs, or in forms or wayes of worſhips which men have ſet up, and by his crying with a loud voice, he was come to deliver it from bondage or from the Gentiles, and ſo from them both: it is I by my coming to Judge all the powers of proud fleſh which hath been an Alien and Gentile to me; and to deſtroy them, burn and conſume them up; as the forms of men and worſhips ſet up by them: that ſo I may deliver them from bondage, ſaith the Lord of hoſts, for the dayes of my coming is at hand.

What doth theſe ſeven torches or lamps ſignifie? And the Lord ſaid: the ſeven lamps burning, ſhews a perfection of light that ſhall be. When the forty and two month (that are ſpoken of) ſhall be at an end: for theſe forty two months are a certain time, ſaith the Lord of hoſts, that I have ſuffered my ſelf to be hid: and my glory hid from the Temple: but now the ſet time is at an end; and my light and glory ſhall ſhine: and as you ſee the lamps burning and none put them out: So will I appear burning up fleſh and ſin, and none ſhall hinder me from doing my work; ſaith the Lord of hoſts, that will reign in mount Sion for ever.

And again the the word of the Lord came unto me, ſaying, what ſeeſt thou now? And I beheld, and ſaw the Moon, and the Sun, and the Heavens, and the Stars, and at length I ſaw them turned into bloud, and they fell from the place that they were in, and fell to the earth: and I ſaw a company of Swine and Dogs lick them up; they being like unto bloud, and with their falling upon the earth, the earth was changed: And I ſaid, Lord, what is this Sun, and Moon, and Heaven, and Stars, which is changed into blood? is it the material Sun that gives light by day, and the Moon that give light by night? And the Heaven; the Heaven that fouls fly
in? and my eternall God, within me, ſaid, No: but by theſe is meant other things: as the Moone is a borrowed Light from the Sunne, and not a perfect Light it ſelfe, ſo by the Moone is meant outward Ordinances that People have and are under, by which they have received ſome Glympſe of Light: but not the Light it ſelfe: by the Sun is meant a more glorious Diſpenſation of outward Ordinances, or Ordinances in a more higher Nature: As the one, being a Baptizing of Infants; and ſo they in this Diſpenſation, fetch Light from Creatures, or from the Men of this World, which ſeemingly have light, but have not: So the other which is of a more higher Nature: as the Baptizing of Believers, is a Sun-light (as they call it:) and ſo the Baptiſme-way of Baptizing Believers, and breaking of Bread together, is a way wherein, according to the Scriptures, they ſeeme to be more like the Sunne, than the other: but yet is not the way which I approve of, ſaith the Lord of Hoſts: and the Heaven, is the Heaven of outward Diſpenſations, and Formes, and wayes of Worſhips, Governments, and Rules to walke by; that ſo long as People living under theſe, and do obſerve punctually to fulfill theſe, as the obſerving the Sabbath Day, Praying, and Preaching, and going to Church, as they call it; and others meeting in private Places, as they thinke fit to meet in, and ſo to heare a Man ſpeake ſomething of God; this is Heaven which People live in, and meant by this Viſion, ſaith the Lord of Hoſts: and the Starres is their profeſſions of God according to the ſeverall Diſpenſations they are under: and ſo this Heaven, and the Starres therein, and the Sunne and Moone mentioned in Scriptures, turned into bloud, is meant, all outward Adminiſtrations, as Formes, Governments, and Rules, and wayes of Worſhips, which have been as lights that People have ſeen ſomething of God in, and ſo have ſeen God at a diſtance from them, are now changed from light to bloud: and ſo are fallen from their places that they may no longer be as lights: and by the Dogges and Swine licking them up: is nothing elſe but a totall Diſtinction of them, that they may never be more: and the People may from hencefortb loath them: and ſee me the Lord of Hoſt, to be all, and in all, for my great and notable Day which theſe ſhall be turned into bloud: my coming to my ſonnes and daughters, and ſo judging all theſe things in them; and making of them darkneſſe; is the Earth that they fell upon: and was changed, and the Dogs and Swines (as is ſet forth by them a totall fall of Worſhips) by licking up the bloud: ſo by them is ſet forth the moſt greateſt and
moſt wickedſt Men: which have by their power ſet up theſe things, a change in them, that they ſhall no longer do ſo any more: but ſhall become new; for I have taken their power from them; and they are become new, ſaith the Lord of Hoſts; and as thou ſeeſt a new Heaven, and a new Sunne and Moon in the place of the former, and a new earth; is but the fulfilling of Propheſies; that have a long tine ſince been ſpoken of; and now are come to paſſe; this new Heaven is the enjoyment of me; they living in me, and I in them; ſo they ſhall have no need of Heaven, of Ordinances or wayes to walk by; but I will be their light; both Sun and Moon; and ſo that they ſhall have no need of theſe lights to walk by: but I will be the glory of them: and as you ſee former things paſſed away and all things become new, it is the paſſing away of the Sun, Moon, Stars, and Heaven; which are outward Adminiſtrations and Formes of Worſhips, Teachers of Men, that, I the Lord of Hoſt, may be both Heaven, Sun, Moon, Stars, and Teacher to, and in them, that they may hear a voice, ſaying, this is the way, wallk in it: and the new earth is a change of Men, which have had power over their fellow Creatures, and did deſire to have ſo, that they may be accounted great: but this was not an Earth wherein Righteouſneſſe dwelt: and ſo muſt paſs away; that there may be a new one; which new one is an alteration or change of Mens mindes; that as they have deſired a ſuperiority, and have ſtrived to cozen and cheat others, for to make themſelves great, they ſhall no longer ſtrive for theſe; but inſtead of them, ſhall humble and abaſe themſelves, and throw away their Idols of Gold and Silver: their money, I mean, which they have made gods of, to them that have none, that there may be equality and univerſality, all injoying the fruit of the Earth, ſaith the Lord of Hoſt, who hath commanded the Writer hereof to write it, as my will and not his, that ſo all things may become now, and there may be an Earth wherein Righteouſneſſe ſhall dwell.

And again, the word of the moſt high, came unto me, ſaying, behold, behold, what ſeeſt thou now? and low! I beheld ſomething almoſt in the faſhion of an houſe; but it was not an houſe: and I ſaid, Lord, what is this? and my God ſaid, it is a tabernacle: and as you ſaw one with a Crown of gold goe into it: it was I the Lord that went into it: and I ſaid, is this the tabernacle of God, that is ſaid to be with men? and the Lord ſaid, it is: and this tabernacle is my people wherein I will dwell: and as he had a Crown of gold that went into it: it betokens a victory, that
I have taken it to be my poſſeſſion: and as ſoon as I was in it, you ſaw flames of fire burn up the gold, pearles, and precious ſtones, and the wood hay and ſtubble; and preſently the Tabernacle that ſtood upon a foundation, had none: but hung onely by the power of him that went into it: this glold, pearles, precious ſtones, wood, hay, ſtuble, which was burnt up: are all manner of outward adminiſtrations that ever were, or is now at preſent; as formes, and lawes, and Governments, and rules of worſhips to walke by; which in one kinde or other have been highly eſteemed of all ſorts of men, according to the diſpenſation they have been under: and though they have laid Chriſt for a foundation, yet theſe hath been, in one ſort or other, the work which they have built upon: which work is to paſſe under the fire, for the Apoſtle ſays, every mans work ſhall be tryed by fire: and if any mans works ſuffer loſs, it will be by burning; yet he ſhall be ſaved ſo as by fire: which fire is my ſelf even I the Lord of hoſts) appearing in this tabernacle ſpoken of: which as ſoon as I did appear or entred in, all was conſumed, and burnt up: all the moſt glorious diſpenſations and formes of worſhips which in my abſence they have received comfort from: though all theſe outward adminiſtrations are conſumed, yet the creatures remained, ſaved by fire: that is, by my ſelf ſaith the Lord of hoſts, who am a conſuming fire: and as you ſee the temple as ſoon as theſe outward things?
